tool.name: OrthoFinder
tool.description: OrthoFinder is a fast, accurate and comprehensive analysis tool for comparative genomics. It finds orthologues and orthogroups infers gene trees for all orthogroups and infers a rooted species tree for the species being analysed

param.name: start_and_end
param.label: Control where analysis starts/finishes:
param.option: Predict orthogroups using pre-calculated BLAST results
Infer gene trees and orthologues starting from pre-computed orthogroups
Infer orthologues starting from pre-computed gene trees

param.name: data_to_give
param.label: Files for pre-computed blast_results / orthogroups / gene trees

param.name: only_prepare
param.label: Only prepare
param.help: Only prepare the BLAST input files in the format required by OrthoFinder.

param.name: inflation
param.label: Inflation parameter
param.help: Modify inflation parameter for MCL. Not recommended. [Default : 1.5]

param.name: only_groups
param.label: Only groups
param.help: Only infer orthogroups, do not infer gene trees of orthologues.

citations.citation: Emms, D.M. and Kelly, S. (2015) OrthoFinder: solving fundamental biases in whole genome comparisons dramatically improves orthogroup inference accuracy, Genome Biology 16:157
